intro: Heptapleurum lasiosphaerum, commonly known as the woolly-leafed holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Pentaphylacaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India, China, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its evergreen, leathery leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs, giving them a woolly appearance. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. The plant is often cultivated as an ornamental due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
